com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveLocationIteratorIf

public interface XhiveLocationIteratorIf

Iterator for a list of XhiveLocationIf objects.

A XhiveLocationIteratorIf is typically returned as the result of requesting the location set value of an XPath or XPointer query result (see XhiveQueryResultIf). Iteration yields XhiveLocationIf objects: locations found during the execution of the query. See XhiveLocationIf on how to further process these locations.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

next

XhiveLocationIf next()
Get the next XhiveLocationIf in the XhiveLocationIf set.

Returns:
The next XhiveLocationIf in the XhiveLocationIf set.
Throws:
XhiveException.OBJECT_DEAD - If the location pointed to does not exist in the database anymore.
Since:
